author: VNExplorer
title: Assam MLA says Himanta Sarma's law repeal move targets Muslims, makes 'UCC' dare
text:
AIUDF MLA Hafiz Rafiqul Islam
Guwahati: AIUDF MLA Hafiz Rafiqul Islam on Saturday said Himanta Biswa Sarma-led Assam government doesn’t have the courage to bring the Uniform Civil Code in the state on the lines of Uttarakhand. Reacting to the government’s decision to repeal the Assam Muslim Marriages and Divorces Registration Act, he said the move appears to be taken to target Muslims.
“This government doesn’t have the courage to bring UCC. They can’t do it. What they brought in Uttarakhand, is not UCC either…They were trying to bring UCC to Assam too. But I think they can’t bring it to Assam because there are people from several castes and communities here…BJP followers themselves follow those practices here,” he told ANI.
He said the BJP government is employing these tactics because the elections are approaching.
“Elections are approaching, this is just their tactics to target Muslims. So, they couldn’t bring any Bill on polygamy or UCC in Assam…So, they are repealing the Assam Muslim Marriages & Divorces Registration Act. The Assam cabinet doesn’t have the right to repeal or amend a constitutional right,” he added.
The Assam cabinet on Friday gave the nod to repeal the British Raj-era law.
“This Act contained provisions allowing marriage registration even if the bride and groom had not reached the legal ages of 18 and 21 respectively, as required by law. This move marks another significant step towards prohibiting child marriages in Assam,” the chief minister posted on X.
The law gives authority to Muslim registrars to register voluntary declaration of marriages and divorces.
After this law is repealed, the district authorities will take over the custody of the registration records held by 94 Muslim marriage registrars.
Registration of marriages and divorces is not mandatory as per the Act and the machinery of registration is informal, leaving a lot of scope for non-compliance with extant norms, the government said, PTI reported.
The Uttarakhand government earlier this month got the UCC bill passed in the state assembly. The bill seeks to replace personal religious laws governing marriage, divorces and inheritance, with a common set of rules applicable to all religions equally. Several Muslim bodies, however, pointed out that tribals were exempted from the ambit of the legislation.
Himanta Biswa Sarma has vowed that Assam will be the third state after Uttarakhand and Gujarat to implement the Uniform Civil Code. In January, he said it would take two-three months to table the bill. He also said that he plans to keep tribals out of the purview of the planned law.
Read more news like this on HindustanTimes.com

author: redaccion@heraldo.es (E. P.)
title: Muere el sacerdote, Luis García Torrecilla, archivero diocesano de Huesca hasta 2021
text: Muere el sacerdote, Luis García Torrecilla, archivero diocesano de Huesca hasta 2021 El funeral tendrá lugar este sábado, 24 de febrero, a las 11.00 en la Santa Iglesia Catedral de Huesca. El reverendo, Luis García Torrecilla, quien fuera archivero diocesano de [Huesca ](https://www.heraldo.es/tags/lugares/huesca.html)hasta 2021, ha fallecido este jueves, 22 de febrero, en la capital oscense a los 90 años de edad. La capilla ardiente se ha instalado en la residencia Padre Saturnino López Novoa, situada en la calle Teruel, 1, de la capital oscense en horario de 16.30 a 20.30 horas. El funeral tendrá lugar este sábado, 24 de febrero, a las 11.00 en la Santa Iglesia Catedral de Huesca. Nacido en [Alagón ](https://www.heraldo.es/tags/lugares/alagon.html)(Zaragoza) el 15 de diciembre de 1933, se ordena sacerdote en la ciudad de Zaragoza por Monseñor Casimiro Morcillo González el 15 de agosto de 1958. Además, es licenciado en Teología, ha informado la Diócesis de Huesca. Entre sus funciones pastorales en la Diócesis de Huesca destaca la de rector del Seminario Conciliar entre 1967 y 1971; vicario general entre 1981 y 1989, archivero diocesano entre 1989 y 2021; delegado de Liturgia entre 1989 y 1996; párroco de la Basílica de San Lorenzo entre 1993 y 1998, vicario parroquial de San Lorenzo entre 2005 y 2007 y Capellán de las Hermanas de Santa Ana -Guardería San José- desde 2007. author: @ladepechedumidi
title: Donald Trump contre la Nasa : effectifs supprimés, missions annulées… Comment le président américain démantèle l'agence spatiale - ladepeche.fr
text:
Donald Trump contre la Nasa : effectifs supprimés, missions annulées… Comment le président américain démantèle l'agence spatiale
L’avenir scientifique de la Nasa est en péril. Entre baisses de budget drastiques et série de départs annoncés, l’agence spatiale américaine subit de plein fouet les choix de l’administration Trump, qui s’attaque frontalement à toute recherche scientifique.
Depuis son retour à la Maison Blanche, Donald Trump étrangle la Nasa à coups de coupes budgétaires et de décisions politiques. Selon une enquête de Politico, plus de 2 000 hauts fonctionnaires de l’agence spatiale américaine s’apprêtent à quitter leur poste dans les mois à venir. Démissions, départs anticipés à la retraite, contrats non renouvelés… L’administration Trump prévoit de supprimer jusqu’à 5 000 postes, soit un tiers des effectifs actuels.
En interne, les salariés redoutent désormais des licenciements secs, alors que la plus vaste réduction d’effectifs de l’histoire de la Nasa est en marche. Ce grand plan de départ n’est pas un hasard : en 2026, le président américain prévoit de réduire de 25 % le budget de l'agence. Cette dernière recevrait alors 18,8 milliards de dollars, contre 24,8 milliards en 2025. Une baisse historique qui ramènerait ses ressources à un niveau équivalent à celui... de 1961. Le secteur de la science spatiale, qui a fait la renommée de l’agence avec les sondes Voyager, Viking ou les télescopes Hubble et James-Webb, est particulièrement touché. Son budget sera amputé de 47 %.
"L’annulation de plusieurs missions"
Face à cette hémorragie budgétaire, la Nasa a d’ores et déjà annulé 41 missions prévues d’ici la fin de l’année. Il s’agit principalement de programmes scientifiques et robotiques, comme l’envoi de sondes ou de robots sur Mars et d’autres planètes. "Ces coupes vont provoquer l’annulation de plusieurs missions importantes à venir et l’arrêt de missions déjà en orbite ou en route pour leur objectif" prévient un cadre de l’agence cité par Space News. Ce sont les programmes à long terme, les plus ambitieux sur le plan scientifique, qui sont sacrifiés.
À lire aussi :
Elon Musk et Donald Trump en guerre : milliers d’emplois menacés, course à l’espace… pourquoi "annuler" les contrats de Space X serait une (très) mauvaise idée
Dans le même temps, la gouvernance de l’agence est fragilisée. Après le refus de nommer Jared Isaacman — un proche d’Elon Musk — à la tête de la Nasa, Donald Trump a nommé, en intérim, Sean Duffy, actuel secrétaire aux Transports, ancien candidat de téléréalité… et dépourvu de toute expérience scientifique.
Des rapports inaccessibles
Mais la pression exercée par l’administration Trump dépasse le spatial. Elle touche aussi au climat : les rapports officiels sur le changement climatique, autrefois disponibles sur les sites publics, ont été rendus inaccessibles. La Maison Blanche avait promis que la Nasa prendrait le relais pour assurer la diffusion. Mais l’agence a finalement fait marche arrière, arguant qu’elle n’avait "aucune obligation légale" de publier ces données.
"La nouvelle position est une mauvaise orientation classique de l’administration Trump, déplore John Holdren, ancien conseiller scientifique de Barack Obama. Ils ne veulent tout simplement pas que le public prenne connaissance des informations scientifiques sur les effets du changement climatique."

author: Mary Walrath-Holdridge
title: Kathleen Wilson's Minnesota dentist did 30 procedures at once: lawsuit
text: 20 fillings, 4 root canals, 8 crowns in one visit add up to lawsuit for Minnesota dentist [Mary Walrath-Holdridge](https://www.usatoday.com/staff/12093029002/mary-walrathholdridge/) A Minnesota dentist has become the subject of a malpractice lawsuit after his patient accused him of "disfiguring" her. The civil lawsuit was filed in Hennepin County, Minnesota last week by Kathleen Wilson, who alleged Dr. Kevin Molldrem and [Molldrem Family Dentistry](https://molldremdentistry.com/) caused her significant injury that is still being corrected. According to the suit, Molldrem performed more than 30 producers on Wilson in a single July 2020 visit, doing eight crowns, four root canals and 20 fillings in one go. The lawsuit alleges that the dentist "perform[ed] this work improperly," resulting in pain and suffering, embarrassment, emotional distress, and disfigurement. Molldrem was likewise accused of using improper levels of anesthesia during the procedures and falsifying medical records to cover it up. Treatment called 'inconceivable' “It is inconceivable that Dr. Molldrem could have prepared and placed 8 crowns under these circumstances in the time allotted, not to mention the additional 20 restorations,” wrote [Dr. Avrum Goldstein,](https://www.seakexperts.com/members/4827-avrum-r-goldstein) a dentist and expert witness brought on by Wilson's attorney, in an affidavit. Goldstein, who is a faculty member at [NOVA Southeastern University](https://dental.nova.edu/aboutus/faculty/goldstein-avrum%20.html?_gl=1*1kqtqxq*_gcl_au*ODA4NzUxNTA1LjE3MDM3OTc5MjI.), also wrote that Wilson had been correctly diagnosed as having a "rare condition" causing decay in almost all of her teeth, but Mollderm's course of action was not a proper form of treatment. "[Wilson’s] required a slow, thoughtful, careful and measured response to her disease,” he said in his report. “Trying to fill every hole in every tooth in her mouth in one visit is not only the antithesis of what was indicated, it is not humanly possible to achieve in an effective or constructive manner.” Doctors remove wrong organ from man: [They opened him up to remove his appendix. They mistakenly took out much more, lawsuit says.](/story/news/health/2023/11/07/doctors-accidentally-remove-wrong-organ-surgery/71487292007/) The lawsuit also accused Mollderm of tampering with medical records to falsify the amount of anesthesia that was reportedly used, which in reality was nearly double the standard number of units, according to court paperwork. According to Goldstein, the maximum dose of anesthesia given in three hours should not exceed 490 mg, but Molldrem's records show he gave Wilson 960 mg. “Any negative cardiovascular or central nervous system outcomes could be tied to the local anesthetic overdose," he wrote. Wilson said in the suit that she has since had to have the dental work completely redone by other dentists to repair Molldrem’s “negligent work," an ongoing process that has caused her to lose income and rack up medical bills on top of enduring pain, suffering and embarrassment. She is seeking more than $50,000 in damages. Wilson's attorney and Molldrem did not immediately respond to request for comment.

author: Nebuchanezzar
title: #24 Cómo perder la alcaldía de Pamplona y la reputación en una sola frase
text:
[Osdransky](/user/Osdransky)a [eldiario.es](/go/link/3891544)
La plaza consistorial de Pamplona parece sanfermines en esta moción pero el PP sigue sin entender absolutamente nada!!!!
Idos a tomar por culo!!!!!!!
[#1](c1#c-1) llevan así desde la recogida de firmas para derogar el estatut catalán. Pero que sigan, que sigan.
[#10](c10#c-10) y eso que allí ponen todos los impedimentos posibles para que la gente no vote (sobre todo los grupos poblacionales que no suelen votar a los republicanos).
[#1](c1#c-1) Positivo por el elefante uso del imperativo del verbo ir con el enclético "os". Aunque la real academia admite desde hace años "iros" y todos recordamos con cariño aquel "si me queréis, irse" de la gran Lola no es menos cierto que "Idos a tomar por culo" destila elegancia, clasicismo, ritmo, gracia y donaire en cada sílaba.
[#9](c9#c-9) No hay ningún clasismo, todo lo contrario, está reconociendo la dureza de ese trabajo y el mérito que tiene hacerlo.
Es como si dijera "preferiría trabajar en la mina". Se refiere a la dureza del trabajo.
No va a decir "preferiría trabajar como CEO de un eléctrica", lo cual no suena a trabajo físico duro.
Ningún clasismo, pero lo dice elpanfleto.es, manipulando, y os lo tragáis todo sin masticar. Qué pena. Un poquito de capacidad crítica no os vendría mal, deberíais intentarlo, aunque os cueste, debido a que hay que pensar y eso no es fácil para vosotros. Es más fácil formar parte del rebaño.
Creo que les ha retratado muy bien. Estoy un poco cansado de eldiario pero este artículo es bastante adecuado.
[#0](c0#c-0) gracias
[#2](c2#c-2) Tranquilo, tienen todo el escudo mediático. No lo verás en el telediario de A3, salvo que esa misma frase la hubiera dicho una alcaldesa del PSOE o de SUMAR.
[#5](c5#c-5) Al hilo de lo que dices, hoy he visto las noticias de la noche de A·, con Vicente Vallés, y, en algún momento creía que le iba a dar un infarto: los independentistas, Bildu, traición del PSOE, traición de Sánchez y así así... Uno, si sigue escuchando cree que va a llegar el final de la democracia y el apocalipsis, como mínimo.
[#6](c6#c-6) es indecente lo de ese señor... verlo vomitar bilis de esa manera, da muchisima grima, no se como no le aconseja alguien que se modere un poco
A mí el que me hace gracia es Feijó diciendo que el PSOE ya no es un partido constitucionalista.
Pues no sé, creo que debió quedarse dormido en el artículo 1 porque en el 140 ya te dice de forma general cómo se eligen los concejales y como son éstos los que eligen a un alcalde.
En fin, que habrá quien le compre el discurso, pero no hay por donde cogerlo

author: Arab Times
title: Survivors of Mangaf Fire Praise Kuwait’s Compassionate Response – ARAB TIMES – KUWAIT NEWS
text:
23/06/2024 This news has been read 388 times!
KUWAIT CITY, June 23: Once again, the leadership, government, and people of Kuwait have demonstrated why they were named “Leaders in Humanitarian Work” by the United Nations. This recognition stems from their continuous efforts and significant initiatives to assist those in need worldwide.
The most recent example of this humanitarian spirit was evident in the response to the Mangaf fire and its victims. Survivors of the fire, which claimed 49 lives and injured dozens, have expressed their deep gratitude for the swift and compassionate Kuwaiti response. The injured were promptly transferred to hospitals for treatment.
Kuwait’s announcement of financial compensation for the families of the fire victims was a significant relief for many. Survivors also appreciated the repeated visits from government officials to the accident site and hospitals since the morning of the incident. The efforts of the fire force and medical emergency teams in rescuing the building’s residents were also widely praised.
Several injured workers who had been discharged from hospitals about ten days after the disaster, now residing in temporary housing. In one apartment, three injured individuals, (Supervisor Praveen Raju, driver Nalina Kishan, and worker Dorji Lama)were still recovering with plaster casts on their feet from fractures sustained while jumping from the second floor to escape the thick smoke, reports Al Rai. Raju recounted his escape, noting that he jumped onto a water tanker below but still suffered injuries due to inhaling smoke.
These survivors expressed their heartfelt thanks for the ongoing assistance, highlighting the humanitarian care they received from Kuwaiti officials at all levels. They also acknowledged the support from their home country, particularly the Indian ambassador in Kuwait and embassy staff, who were among the first to arrive at the accident site and maintained constant contact to check on their well-being.
In another apartment, four recently discharged individuals (Sharat, Santosh Pal, driver Anil Om, and storekeeper Faisal Muhammad) were also recovering, with some still in plaster casts. Pal described waking up at five in the morning to screams and attempting to escape through the smoke-filled stairs before returning to his apartment, where those who continued down succumbed to suffocation. Another survivor recounted attempting to descend from the balcony using a television cable, only to fall and break his legs when it snapped. These individuals echoed their colleagues’ gratitude for the humanitarian aid and efforts extended by Kuwait and their embassy.
Injured worker’s families arrive in Kuwait Meanwhile, Five relatives of the workers injured in the Mangaf fire arrived in Kuwait. Four more individuals are expected to arrive this Wednesday. Upon their arrival, the relatives went directly to their accommodations to check the health status of the injured workers.
This news has been read 388 times!

author: Chris Graham
title: Nikki Haley stumped by trick question: What was the cause of the Civil War? - Augusta Free Press
text: [Nikki Haley](https://augustafreepress.com/tag/nikki-haley/), supposedly getting traction in New Hampshire, stepped on her own, whatever, tripped up by a hard question from what she seems to think is a Democratic plant. The hard question: what was the cause of the United States Civil War? Some mean trick, asking that question. “I think the cause of the Civil War was basically how government was going to run, the freedoms and what people could and couldn’t do,” Haley answered at a Wednesday town hall, afraid to say the quiet part out loud, because, you know, woke. Seriously, she was afraid if she said the obvious part out loud – that the Civil War was fought, not over “freedoms and what people could and couldn’t do,” but over slavery – she might offend the MAGA base, which is damn sick and tired of this wokeness nonsense. And then, she stepped on, you know, her whatever a second time, telling a New Hampshire radio host on Thursday that “of course the Civil War was about slavery. We know that. That’s the easy part of it. “ Did you see what she did there? After so obviously kowtowing to the far right in her first answer, she conceded the woke point, losing the MAGAs in the process, while not exactly endearing herself to the rest of the electorate – defined as, those among us who don’t tingle up at thoughts of the Reichstag burning to the ground. She tried to straddle the line with this word salad: “What I was saying was, what does it mean us today?” Haley said. “What it means to us today is about freedom. That’s what that was all about. It was about individual freedom, economic freedom, individual rights. Our goal is to make sure we never go back to the stain of slavery, but what’s the lesson in all of that?” Even [Ron DeSantis](https://augustafreepress.com/tag/ron-desantis/), the dark knight of anti-woke, piled on at this stage. “Not that difficult to identify and acknowledge the role slavery played in the Civil War, and yet that seemed to be something that was really difficult,” DeSantis said. “I don’t even know what she was saying. If you listen to that answer, I know she’s trying to clean it up, I know she’s trying to blame a Democrat plant. Look, I mean, you’re going to get asked a lot of questions, I mean, you’re gonna get asked a lot of tough questions. That’s just the nature of this business. And I think that she’s shown time and time again that when it’s time, when the lights get hot, that she wilts under pressure.” It’s not a good day when DeSanctimonious is dunking on you. Noticeably silent through all of this: [Donald Trump](https://augustafreepress.com/tag/donald-trump/). The sound you hear is him thumbing through his crayon-annotated Mein Kampf, searching desperately for the section on what the Civil War was about.

author: Lauren McNeil
title: Peachy in Penticton and stoked in Revelstoke, BC’s most welcoming towns - Kelowna Capital News
text: Take a drive through B.C. and you’ll be greeted with the beauty of nature’s playground. It’s no secret that the province provides bountiful natural beauty, so much so that the province’s license plate reads: Beautiful B.C. However, it’s not just the mountains and rugged coasts that have captured visitors’ attention. B.C. leaves a lasting impression because of its kind people which is why WorldAtlas released its [eight most welcoming BC towns](https://www.worldatlas.com/cities/8-most-welcoming-towns-in-british-columbia.html?fbclid=IwAR21yKzvbm4kCkMX9qtGjfvWgvhTFLcT6goZo6xtpUjweOaKPK-VFIJJ1wc). Two of B.C.’s interior towns topped the list with Revelstoke coming in with the number three position and Penticton at number five. Revelstoke boasts the longest vertical descent at any ski resort in North America and is home to an inland temperate rainforest which is why WorldAtlas dubbed it a “goldmine for outdoor enthusiasts.” This love for the outdoors has fostered a family-like community for outdoorsy folks. That family-like vibe carries over to the art scene as well. Every September, the mountain town hosts Luna Fest, a festival which illuminates the town with music and art installations. Coming in as the fifth most welcoming B.C. town is Penticton. Located south of Kelowna’s wineries, Penticton is home to the Okanagan and Skaha lakes. Nicknamed ‘Peach City,’ it’s hard not to feel peachy when visiting Penticton and its renowned farmer’s market. The market is home to over 45 vendors, while the town is a gateway to picturesque hiking trails such as the Kettle Rail Trail. READ MORE: [ Glimpses of Revelstoke’s past for Dec. 28](https://www.revelstokereview.com/local-news/glimpses-of-revelstokes-past-for-dec-28-7290493)

author: Sophie Rosenthal
title: DC official resigns after investigation finds she had 2 full-time jobs
text: WASHINGTON — D.C.’s Department of Buildings Deputy Director Caroline Lian, has resigned after an ethics probe found that in addition to her six-figure paying full-time job at the DOB, she also secretly had a second six-figure paying full-time job in the private sector. According to the Board of Ethics and Government Accountability probe , Lian started working at the DOB in October 2022 as its chief operations officer — a position for which she was paid $149,750 per year. One year later, Lian was promoted to deputy director, which included a raise; her promoted salary was $175,000 per year. In Lian’s position, she typically worked in-office Monday and Friday and from home Tuesday through Thursday. But Lian had another position — one she’d had since July 2015. She was employed as a third-party risk management director with Freddie Mac, also known as the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp. She earned another six-figure salary from Freddie Mac, and she worked from home Monday and Friday and in-office Tuesday through Thursday. On top of both of those jobs, Lian had a third, part-time position. She was elected to serve a four year term on the Falls Church City Council from 2022 to 2025. Her third position paid her $9,200 a year. Lian did not disclose her second job, according to the probe. In her required public financial disclosure statements for 2022 and 2023 — where she was required to disclose any outside activity or employment that she made more than $200 — she did not report any money she made from Freddie Mac. And though Lian did disclose her third job on the city council, she reported her time wrong. When she took off for city council meetings on more than 10 occasions, she would report a full day of work for the DOB, instead of using annual leave hours. In 2022, she also underreported her income, saying she only made less than $1,000 from Falls Church, though she did submit an amendment and said that she mistakenly picked the wrong category of income on the form. The ethics board decided that Lian had violated the code of conduct in four ways. For that, she agreed to pay a fine of $25,000 to the district. The board said she would be able to pay in installments after paying a lump sum of $17,000 by Aug. 2 and going to an ethics training no later than Oct. 31. But when she resigned, she also resigned to the terms of the settlement, that the full amount would come from her final district government paycheck or from compensation for unused annual leave. RELATED: [Former Prince George's County councilman charged with stealing $100k+ in campaign funds for personal use](/article/news/crime/prince-georges-county-councilman-mel-franklin-charged-with-stealing-campaign-funds/65-cf9e9df9-863a-4f24-85c5-147519c5f6e5)

author: Champion.com.ua
title: Не выдержали нервы: звездный защитник разводится с женой из-за ее увлечения таро| Футбол | Champion.com.ua
text:
Верила в таро и эзотерику: звезда Манчестер Юнайтед разводится с женой при странных обстоятельствах
Неожиданные новости из личной жизни одного из самых известных нидерландских защитников. Маттейс де Лигт разводится со своей женой Аннеке, с которой встречался еще с юношеских лет в Аяксе.
Их союз считали образцовым, однако, как сообщают голландские СМИ, пара окончательно разошлась.
Причина довольно необычная. По информации изданий, футболист "больше не мог мириться с одержимостью жены эзотерикой и духовными практиками".
Аннеке не скрывала своего увлечения – в соцсетях она публиковала фото с картами Таро, книгами об астрологии и энергии, а также рассказывала о "внутренних потоках".
Несмотря на то, что брак длился много лет и пара прошла через многочисленные переезды и футбольные вызовы, увлечения Аннеке, похоже, стали тем "последним камнем преткновения", который привел к финалу истории.
Напомним, в прошлом сезоне на счету 25-летнего нидерландца 2 гола в 29 матчах Манчестер Юнайтед в рамках АПЛ. Контракт с игроком рассчитан до лета 2029 года.
Ранее сообщалось, что бывшая звезда тенниса и легенда Баварии разошлись после восьми лет брака.
